pli-tv-pvr1.8:1.1: For having sexual intercourse, how many kinds of offenses does one commit?
pli-tv-pvr1.8:1.2: One commits three kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr1.8:1.3: when one has sexual intercourse with an undecomposed corpse, one commits an offense entailing expulsion;
pli-tv-pvr1.8:1.4: when one has sexual intercourse with a mostly decomposed corpse, one commits a serious offense;
pli-tv-pvr1.8:1.5: when one inserts the penis without touching into a wide open mouth, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-pvr1.8:2.1: When it comes to these offenses, to how many of the four kinds of failure do they belong? In how many of the seven classes of offenses are they found? Through how many of the six kinds of origins of offenses do they originate? To which of the four kinds of legal issues do they belong? Through how many of the seven principles for settling legal issues are they settled?
pli-tv-pvr1.8:2.2: They belong to two kinds of failure:
pli-tv-pvr1.8:2.3: they may be failure in morality; they may be failure in conduct.
pli-tv-pvr1.8:2.4: They are found in three classes of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr1.8:2.5: they may be in the class of offenses entailing expulsion; they may be in the class of serious offenses; they may be in the class of offenses of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-pvr1.8:2.8: They are legal issues arising from an offense.
pli-tv-pvr1.8:2.9: They are settled in three ways:
pli-tv-pvr1.8:2.10: they may be settled by resolution face-to-face and by acting according to what has been admitted; or they may be settled by resolution face-to-face and by covering over as if with grass. …
